page.title: 02NEW SHOPPING PRECINCT, RHYL
page.content: The White Rose Shopping Precinct opened on the 6th September, 1984. It was developed by Beacontree Estates Ltd.,in association with Philips's Pension Fund and the Land Authority of Wales. It cost Â£4,500,000 and was named after the garage which was on the site previously. 24 shops are already open and 5 more should be occupied by the end of July. Two lifts carry people to the roof car park which has 335 spaces but no further levels can be added. There are two entrances from the High Street and one from Church Street where the new public library is being built. Marks & Spencers, Boots and Woolworths have all extended their premises to gain access to it. The 13 staff include the Manager, his Secretary, 3 security guards, electricians, mechanics and cleaners.
